noun.description: More fully "Skidi Pawnee". A member of a North American Indian people constituting a division of the Pawnee, and originally inhabiting the Loup River valley, Nebraska.

adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating the Skidi or their dialect.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in Edwin James (1797–1861). From Pawnee ckí:ri, self-designation from ckirir- wolf, coyote.
